annonstext:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.

Take the opportunity to join in and influence the future of powertrain development!

Are you interested in evolving our SW product development infrastructure environment, testing and quality assurance and believe in the importance of environmentally friendly, sustainable transport? This is what we at Scania work towards every day on a journey that involves major technological steps in more efficient drivelines, emission impact and solutions for electrification.

As a developer, you will gain a broad knowledge of the control system with a good overview of how the functions are connected in the software. As SW developer at Embedded Tools and Test Environment, you are involved in developing an exciting and increasingly global product. You belong to a group that is constantly working towards an virtualized environment.

Today our group of fifteen colleagues develop existing and new SW test tools and applications, various HIL and SIL models as well as test development environments. We value humility, creativity, problem solving and critical thinking in our quest to provide Scania with a world class development service. To achieve this, we prioritize a pleasant working environment with a healthy work/life balance. We offer a job where every day is rich in content, and where your Scania career and personal development are an important aspect of our business.

Assignment
You work on developing and integrating testing solutions for an ECU system focusing ICE and BEV powertrains. You will be part of our group that provides the organization with a complete test environment solution.  An important part of your assignment is to explore new methods and ideas as we constantly search for better ways to develop and verify future products. As OTA updates and cyber security gain in importance these areas will form a core part of your assignment along with ECU flashing/manipulation methods at R&D. Your personal growth opportunities in our organization are large and wide. Depending on your interest, there is scope to become an expert in the field of SW or test development, take responsibility for competence groups or project management among many other things. The job is varied and requires smooth cooperation in the entire development chain. The contact networks you build will give you good opportunities throughout the company.   

Your profile
You are a curious and driven developer with solid experience in programming, software development and maintenance. You are proficient in C# and its accompanying .NET framework as well as Object Oriented Programming in general. You also have Python experience. As data analytics becomes more prevalent in our product development and evaluation, we consider such skills advantageous. Good cloud and container knowledge would also be beneficial.

We would also like you to have an interest in embedded systems, tests, driveline development or vehicles. You are fluent in English. Swedish language skills are also very useful. 

In order to thrive within Scania you should have a technically critical mindset, embrace challenges and understand the importance of cooperation. You have the ability to quickly familiarize yourself with unknown coupled with a desire to find solutions together with your colleagues. Continuous improvement is part of our daily work.   

We offer
In addition to career and development opportunities, Scania offers other benefits such as a discounted company car, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, subsidized lunches and much more. From Stockholm we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Job Express. 

For more information
Dont hesitate to conctact FIRSTNAME LASTNAME, groupmanager, tel:  TELEPHONENO Application
Your application should contain your CV and an introductory letter briefly describing who you are. Attach copies of your qualifications. Screening and interviews will be done continuously. 

We are looking forward to read your application! 

 

 

Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2018, we delivered 88 000 trucks, 8 500 buses as well as 12 800 industrial and marine engines to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 137 billion, of which about 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 52 000 people. Research and development are concentrated in Sweden, with branches in Brazil and India. Production takes place in Europe, Latin America and Asia, with regional production centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON.SE. For more information visit www.scania.com.

Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.

Take the opportunity to join in and influence the future of powertrain development!

Are you interested in evolving our SW product development infrastructure environment, testing and quality assurance and believe in the importance of environmentally friendly, sustainable transport? This is what we at Scania work towards every day on a journey that involves major technological steps in more efficient drivelines, emission impact and solutions for electrification.

As a developer, you will gain a broad knowledge of the control system with a good overview of how the functions are connected in the software. As SW developer at Embedded Tools and Test Environment, you are involved in developing an exciting and increasingly global product. You belong to a group that is constantly working towards an virtualized environment.

Today our group of fifteen colleagues develop existing and new SW test tools and applications, various HIL and SIL models as well as test development environments. We value humility, creativity, problem solving and critical thinking in our quest to provide Scania with a world class development service. To achieve this, we prioritize a pleasant working environment with a healthy work/life balance. We offer a job where every day is rich in content, and where your Scania career and personal development are an important aspect of our business.

Assignment
You work on developing and integrating testing solutions for an ECU system focusing ICE and BEV powertrains. You will be part of our group that provides the organization with a complete test environment solution.  An important part of your assignment is to explore new methods and ideas as we constantly search for better ways to develop and verify future products. As OTA updates and cyber security gain in importance these areas will form a core part of your assignment along with ECU flashing/manipulation methods at R&D. Your personal growth opportunities in our organization are large and wide. Depending on your interest, there is scope to become an expert in the field of SW or test development, take responsibility for competence groups or project management among many other things. The job is varied and requires smooth cooperation in the entire development chain. The contact networks you build will give you good opportunities throughout the company.

You are proficient in C# and its accompanying .NET framework as well as Object Oriented Programming in general. You also have Python experience. We are looking forward to read your application! 

 

 


Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2018, we delivered 88 000 trucks, 8 500 buses as well as 12 800 industrial and marine engines to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 137 billion, of which about 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 52 000 people. Research and development are concentrated in Sweden, with branches in Brazil and India. Production takes place in Europe, Latin America and Asia, with regional production centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON.SE. For more information visit www.scania.com.
